Developer Documentation¶

Python Code¶

Gate One consists of gateone.py and several supporting Python modules and scripts. The documentation for each can be found below:

  • auth.py - Authentication Classes
    • Authentication
      • None or Anonymous
      • Kerberos
      • Google Authentication
      • API Authentication
    • Docstrings
  • authpam.py - A PAM Authentication Module
  • gateone.py - Gate One's Main Script
    • Gate One
      • Dependencies
      • Settings
      • File Paths
      • Running
      • Plugins
    • Class Docstrings
  • logviewer.py - Session Log Viewer
    • Log Viewer
    • About Gate One's Log Format
    • Class Docstrings
  • remote_syslog.py - A module to send syslog messaged directly over UDP
  • sso.py - A Tornado Kerberos Single Sign-On Module
    • About The SSO Module
      • Troubleshooting
    • Class Docstrings
  • terminal.py - A Pure Python Terminal Emulator
    • About This Module
      • Supported Emulation Types
      • What Terminal Doesn't Do
      • Special Considerations
      • Asynchronous Use
      • Using Terminal
      • About The Scrollback Bufffer
    • Class Docstrings
  • termio.py - Terminal Input/Output Module
    • About termio
    • Module Functions and Classes
  • utils.py - Supporting Functions

JavaScript Code¶

A large and very important part of Gate One is the client-side JavaScript that runs in the user's browser. This consists of the following:

  • gateone.js
    • GateOne.Base
    • GateOne
      • Properties
        • prefs
      • Functions
    • GateOne.Utils
      • Functions
    • GateOne.Net
      • Properties
      • Functions
    • GateOne.Input
      • Properties
      • Functions
    • GateOne.Visual
      • Properties
      • Functions
    • GateOne.Terminal
      • Properties
      • Functions
    • GateOne.User
      • Properties
      • Functions
  • go_process.js

Plugin Code¶

Gate One comes bundled with a number of plugins which can include any number of files in Python, JavaScript, or CSS (yes, you could have a CSS-only plugin!). These included plugins are below:

  • The Bookmarks Plugin
    • JavaScript
    • Python
      • Hooks
      • Docstrings
  • The Convenience Plugin
  • The Example Plugin
    • JavaScript
    • Python
      • Hooks
      • Docstrings
  • The Help Plugin
    • JavaScript
  • The Logging Plugin
    • JavaScript
    • Python
      • Hooks
      • Docstrings
  • The Mobile Plugin
    • JavaScript
  • The Notice Plugin
    • Hooks
    • Docstrings
  • The Playback Plugin
    • JavaScript
    • Python
      • Hooks
      • Docstrings
  • The SSH Plugin
    • JavaScript
    • Python
      • Hooks
      • Docstrings

Developing Plugins¶

Developing plugins for Gate One is easy and fun. See The Example Plugin for how it's done.

Embeddeding Gate One Into Other Applications¶

  • Embedding Gate One Into Other Applications
    • Placement
    • Include gateone.js
    • Call GateOne.init()
    • API Authentication
      • Enable API Authentication
      • Generate an API Key/Secret
      • Generate An Auth Object
    • Example API Authentication Code
      • Python
      • PHP
      • Ruby
